security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown guidelines for AI behavior. No executable code, file system access, or network operations. The static findings are false positives triggered by documentation strings (metadata URLs, placeholder examples, and FAQ text) that the scanner misinterpreted as security patterns.

content.value_statement: Users spend too much time managing email workflows manually. This skill provides structured guidelines for reading, drafting, and sending emails through Gmail MCP tools with proper validation and language matching.
actual_capabilities: List and browse recent emails in inbox
Read full email content with attachments
Search for specific emails by criteria
Draft email replies in matching language
limitations: Cannot send emails without explicit user approval
Limited to Gmail MCP tool capabilities

use_cases.title: Quick email triage
use_cases.description: Browse inbox and read important emails efficiently

use_cases.title: Language-matched responses
use_cases.description: Draft replies in the same language as received emails

use_cases.title: Draft review workflow
use_cases.description: Create email drafts for team review before sending

prompt_templates.title: Read specific email
prompt_templates.prompt: Read the third email from today

prompt_templates.title: Draft reply
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft a reply to this email

prompt_templates.title: Send new email
prompt_templates.prompt: Send an email to team@example.com about the project update

output: From: support@service.net - Your Ticket #12345 - 2 days ago

output_examples.input: Draft a reply to this email
output: Thank you for your message. I will review and get back to you shortly.

output_examples.input: Search for emails about the project
output: - Project Timeline Update - From: manager@company.com - Yesterday
- Project Budget Approval - From: finance@company.com - Last week
- Project Kickoff Notes - From: lead@company.com - 2 weeks ago

best_practices: Always ask for user confirmation before sending any email
Match the language of incoming emails for replies
Keep email drafts concise and focused on key points
anti_patterns: Sending emails without explicit user approval
Ignoring the original email language when drafting replies
Creating overly verbose email drafts with unnecessary pleasantries

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It requires Gmail MCP tools to be configured.

faq.question: What are the email sending limits?
faq.answer: Limits depend on your Gmail account type and MCP tool configuration. Standard Gmail limits apply.

faq.question: Can I use this with multiple Gmail accounts?
faq.answer: Yes. Specify the account using 1Password item names like Gmail Zama Claude or Gmail Personal Claude.

faq.question: Is my email data stored anywhere?
faq.answer: No. The skill only reads email content through MCP tools. Data remains in your Gmail account.

faq.question: Why was my draft rejected?
faq.answer: Drafts require explicit confirmation. Review the draft and reply with yes or send it to proceed.

faq.question: How is this different from email filters?
faq.answer: This skill provides AI-assisted reading and drafting. Email filters automate sorting. They work together.
